Quackbot IRC Framework v3
 PREV CLASS   NEXT CLASS FRAMES    NO FRAMES    
SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

Quackbot
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  Quackbot.Controller

public class Controller
extends Object

Quackbot is an advanced IRC bot framework based off of PircBot.

At the core, its a ready made IRC bot that does everything a normal bot should: Support for connection to multiple servers, Proper multithreading, abstraction of commands, hooks into any part of execution, and persistence by database

This is the main class of Quackbot, configuring and managing everything. There should only be ONE instance, which is accessable with instance.

If this is being used in a larger project, it is highly recommended to start this in its own thread

A minimal setup should look like this:
Controller ctrl = new Controller(); //Initalize ctrl.connectDB("databasename", 10, "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver", "jdbc:mysql://url.com/databasename", null, null, "username", "password"); //connect to database ctrl.start(); //Execute Quackbot
All of those calls are absolutly nessesary. Leaving out connectDB will yeild a QuackbotException, leaving out start will just not do anything

Other methods of intrest include addPlugin(Quackbot.PluginType), addPrefix(java.lang.String), addServer(java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String[]), and initHooks

Please read documentation for more explination

initHooks

public static final List<InitHook> initHooks
A list of Hooks that will be executed first during start().

Example of execution
static { Controller.initHooks.add(new InitHook() { public void run(Controller ctrl) { //do something } }); }

See Also:
InitHook

mainPool

public static final ExecutorService mainPool
ThreadPool that all non-bot threads are executed in

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Executues Quackbot. Loads plugins, starts service plugins, connects to servers. If this isn't called, then the bot does nothing

Starts bot using server object

addServer

public void addServer(String address,
                      int port,
                      String... channels)
Creates a new server, adds to database, and connects

Parameters:
address - Address of server
port - Port number to be used (if null, the 6667 is used)
channels - Vararg of channels to join

removeServer

public void removeServer(String address)
Deletes a server by address name, removing from database. This will NOT disconnect the associated bot.

Parameters:
address - The address of the server to be deleted

sendGlobalMessage

public void sendGlobalMessage(String msg)
Send a message to every channel on every server Quackbot is connected to. Use carefully!

Parameters:
msg - Message to send

connectDB

public void connectDB(String databaseName,
                      int poolSize,
                      DataSource dataSource,
                      String catalogPattern,
                      String schemaPattern)
Create a DatabaseManager instance using a supplied DataSource.

This simply calls dbm = new DatabaseManager(databaseName, poolSize, dataSource, catalogPattern, schemaPattern);

Parameters:
databaseName - the name to associate with the DatabaseManager instance
poolSize - the number of instances to manage
dataSource - the data source that supplies connections
catalogPattern - the catalogPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)
schemaPattern - the schemaPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)

connectDB

public void connectDB(String databaseName,
                      int poolSize,
                      String jndiUri,
                      String catalogPattern,
                      String schemaPattern)
Connect to Database using using JNDI.

This simply calls dbm = new DatabaseManager(databaseName, poolSize,jndiUri, catalogPattern, schemaPattern);

Parameters:
databaseName - the name to associate with the DatabaseManager instance
poolSize - the number of instances to manage
jndiUri - the JNDI URI
catalogPattern - the catalogPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)
schemaPattern - the schemaPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)

connectDB

public void connectDB(String databaseName,
                      int poolSize,
                      String jndiUri,
                      String catalogPattern,
                      String schemaPattern,
                      String username,
                      String password)
Create a DatabaseManager instance using JNDI.

This simply calls dbm = new DatabaseManager(databaseName, poolSize, jndiUri, catalogPattern, schemaPattern, username, password);

Parameters:
databaseName - the name to associate with the DatabaseManager instance
poolSize - the number of instances to manage
jndiUri - the JNDI URI
catalogPattern - the catalogPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)
schemaPattern - the schemaPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)
username - the username to use for signon
password - the password to use for signon

connectDB

public void connectDB(String databaseName,
                      int poolSize,
                      String driver,
                      String url,
                      String catalogPattern,
                      String schemaPattern)
Create a DatabaseManager instance using a supplied database driver.

This simply calls dbm = new DatabaseManager(databaseName, poolSize, driver, url, catalogPattern, schemaPattern);

Parameters:
databaseName - the name to associate with the DatabaseManager instance
poolSize - the number of instances to manage
driver - the database driver class name
url - the driver oriented database url
catalogPattern - the catalogPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)
schemaPattern - the schemaPattern (can contain SQL wildcards)

connectDB
